alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued January 14 at 5:57AM CST until January 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Likely Saturday across the Southern Edwards Plateau and Rio Grande Plains... .A dry cold front will move through the region during the pre- dawn hours early Saturday. Very strong northwest winds will develop behind the front, with gusts near 40 mph possible through the day coinciding with minimum RH values in the upper teens in the afternoon. Fuels are drought stressed and cured through this region. Therefore, it is likely that critical fire weather conditions will occur. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY NORTHWEST WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS... * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 17 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread very rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Atascosa; Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala
